channel.title: Jon Udell on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Jon Udell on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Jon Udell, "Why Johnny Can't Syndicate", Friday January 18 2013, noon to 1:00 p.m., University of Michigan School of Information
item.description: Copied from the event announcement: Date and time:   01/18/2013 - 12:00pm - 1:00pm Location:   Ehrlicher Room, 3100 North Quad Speaker:   Jon Udell Sponsor:   Yahoo, School of Information In this lecture on "Why Johnny Can't Syndicate," speaker Jon Udell will review a case study — conducted in Ann Arbor and elsewhere — that uses the syndication of public calendars to explore what people do and don't understand about the Web's core principles, how we can enlarge that understanding, and why it matters that we do.

item.title: Jon Udell and Andrew Turner talking about neogeography
item.description: Two friends, Jon Udell and Andrew Turner, in this piece on IT Conversations: Neocartography, neogeography, the geospatial web: These words and phrases evoke the unfolding drama at the intersection of physical and virtual space. Andrew Turner is in the thick of the action. In this conversation with host Jon Udell he discusses GeoCommons, pocketmaps, collaborative data curation, and the evolution of design in a world of networked spatial and temporal data.
